content.raw: We should maybe also talk about namespacing. In the act of porting to PyQt5 we could replace all the "from QtGui import \*" and add in QtGui.Class at the appropriate places instead. Where QtGui stands in for any Qt Module. This is a bunch of work (that I happened to have already done once) and has little benefit except for decluttering the global namespace. So should we do that or do we want to keep the convenience of import *?
content.html: We should maybe also talk about namespacing. In the act of porting to PyQt5 we could replace all the "from QtGui import *" and add in QtGui.Class at the appropriate places instead. Where QtGui stands in for any Qt Module. This is a bunch of work (that I happened to have already done once) and has little benefit except for decluttering the global namespace. So should we do that or do we want to keep the convenience of import *?
